intro: Euryops mucosus, commonly known as the sticky everlasting or sticky daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically hairy and glandular, contributing to its sticky texture. Euryops mucosus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
